quotes.quote: Immaturity is the incapacity to use one's intelligence without the guidance of another.
There's a level of immaturity to people who just can't clean up after themselves.
For many, immaturity is an ideal, not a defect.
Comb your immaturity if you want to grow.
Another unsettling element in modern art is that common symptom of immaturity, the dread of doing what has been done before.
Remaining childish is a tremendous state of innocence.
A childish mind griped to unexpected changes.
He's like a child, but without a child's capacity for joy.
Revenge is always the weak pleasure of a little and narrow mind.
I was very immature when I was young, and for me there was no balance. Everything was just all or nothing.
Most people grow old, but not everybody grows up.
If you keep playing games you're going to be playing them alone.
As long as people believe in absurdities they will continue to commit atrocities.
Some people are like trees, they take forever to grow up.
... Nine-year-old boys usually turn ten at some point. It's the nineteen-year-olds who have difficulty turning twenty.
We're kind of like the smoking section in high school. We're immature, keep to ourselves.
You are only young once, but you can stay immature indefinitely
Our element is unending immaturity.
Inconsistencies in men are generally testimony to their immaturity
What I look forward to is continued immaturity followed by death.
There were times my immaturity kept me from being all I wanted to be.
This weekend showed our immaturity. We're not the team that we thought we were.
To the immature, other people are not real.
To resolve problems through negotiation is a very childish approach.
Making bad decisions is a part of life. Blaming others for your bad decisions is immature.
Immature is the love of the youth, and immature his hatred of man and earth. His mind and the wings of his spirit are still tied down and heavy.
People who have no hold over their process of thinking are likely to be ruined by liberty of thought. If thought is immature, liberty of thought becomes a method of converting men into animals.
Some people need to stop being immature. Seriously grow up.
Immature is aword boring people use to describe fun people.
Just because your pain is understandable, doesn't mean your behavior is acceptable.
An adult can correctly tell a kid, ‘what you are I was and what I am you will be’. And unlike a child he cannot misplace priority due to purity and immaturity.
Immaturity exists in every human; however, it becomes the prisoner of the maturity force, whether it is real or pretended; it naturally escapes on many occasions.
Man’s growth is held back by his surrender to other people’s expectation that he remain the person he was when they met him.
In short, immaturity is spoiled. And what is spoiled doesn’t ripen. It goes bad early, gets bitter and withers on the vine.
Continuously feeling superior is a characteristic of immaturity.
The young have all the same flaws adults do. Plus one: immaturity.
Maturity comes not with age but with the acceptance of responsibility. You are only young once but immaturity can last a lifetime!

Immaturity means self-centeredness, inability to compromise, to rise above hurt feelings, to postpone immediate pleasures in favor of future benefits, or to do unpleasant chores when they need to be done.
So far in the history of the world, there have never been enough mature people in the right places.
The most dangerous members of our society are those grownups whose powers of influence are adult but whose motives and responses are infantile.
The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.
You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.

You are physically and socially mature. You are, of course, intellectually immature. So are we, on the staff; so is everybody. In the intellectual world the only mature people are those who are willing to admit their immaturity.
An immature ear of corn appears first.
Politics are usually the executive expression of human immaturity.
Imagination: the supreme delight of the immortal and the immature.
The first sign of maturity is not reacting to others' immaturity.
Maturity does not match, with immaturity.
Longing for the ideal, while criticizing the real is evidence of immaturity.
Premature panic is the sign of an immature mind!
Intoxication is a form of escape often sought by the mentally immature.
And, the immature me / Hopes the world sees just who you are, / A facade only gets you so far / And I'm bigger than you / So I can't meet you where you are.

I could be getting old, but I'm getting round / Call it immature, sure, but hear me out / 'Cause the only thing promised is the here and now / If we didn't live it up, never live it down, / And when I jump I hold on, I'm like, "oh my Lord" / If it all goes wrong then it's all my fault.
I know how hard you try for me / But I'm immature I run away for fun / I guess I'm not ready for a good love / And I'm the bad bad one / I'm the bad bad one.
